info.description:
This is a sample documentation for the GSRS api. The api is located at https://gsrs.ncats.nih.gov/ginas/app/api/v1.
A copy of the GSRS schema and data dictionary can be found on the Downloads page

Please note that the demos of the 'Create / Update' and 'Administrative' calls will not work here and need to be tested on a local instance while logged in as an admin.
info.title: GSRS API

tags.name: text search
tags.description: Search by name, code, or other text fields

tags.name: meta search
tags.description: Search within facets, filters, and suggestion lists

tags.name: create and update
tags.description: Create, update, validate and approve records

tags.name: user saved list
tags.description: Create, retrive, update, and delete user saved list

tags.name: Administrative
tags.description: User and data management, back-end tasks and info

get.description: Returns paging list of substances, wrapped in a response with meta information. View can be expanded or collapsed (e.g. ?view=full for expanded)

post.description: Create a new substance record by posting a full JSON record of the substance. This will also perform validation before creation, but will only fail on an "error" level validation rule.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: json of the substance

500.description: Error in substance validation

put.description: Update an existing substance record with a new JSON. This will also perform validation before creation, but will only fail on an "error" level validation rule. Note that this update matches substance records based on the "uuid" field of the submitted JSON.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: json of the substance

500.description: Error in substance validation

get.description: Returns paging list of vocabularies and terms used in the GSRS system.

post.description: Returns validation results of the CV in the GSRS system.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: json of the CV

500.description: CV not understood

get.description: Returns a specific substance JSON based on an id. The id is typically the uuid of a record which is simply a randomly generated universally unique id used internally for each substance record. This id is not meant for deep external use, but is flexible for internal use. Unique names and codes can also be used as id elements in these end points.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.description: Returns a specific substance JSON based on a unique name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A unique name of the substance.

500.description: Record name or path not understood

get.description: Gets a JSONArray of the names for that substance. Names are objects which include data on the name type, language and other meta data as well as the name strings themselves.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.description: Gets a JSONArray of the codes for that substance. Codes include external identifiers for substances, as well as classification and external links used by other substance-related resources.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.description: Gets the first code object in the codes list for that substance.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.summary: Get the first code object's code string
get.description: Gets the first code object's literal code text string in the codes list for that substance

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.description: Gets all "official" names for a given substance.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.description: Gets a JSONArray of only the "name" literal string for each name in the substance

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.description: Gets a JSONArray of only the 'name' string for each name in the substance, only when the name is of "common name" type.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.summary: Get JSONArray of first common name
get.description: Gets a JSONArray of only the "name" string for each name in the substance, only when the name is of "common name" type, limiting to 1 value

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.summary: Get JSONArray of first common name, skipping first value
get.description: Gets a JSONArray of only the 'name' string for each name in the substance, only when the name is of "common name" type, skiping the first value, and limiting to 1 value

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.summary: Get JSONArray of names by creation date (ascending)
get.description: Gets a JSONArray of names, sorted by their creation date (ascending)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.description: Gets a JSONArray of names, sorted by their creation date (descending)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.summary: JSONArray of users who created a name
get.description: Gets a JSONArray of all the distinct users who created a name

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.description: Gets a JSONString of the molfile for a structure

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.summary: Get raw text for the molfile of a structure
get.description: Gets a raw text form of a molfile, with plain text mime type

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.description: Generates an InChIKey for the structure. ['inchikey' is a function that is defined by an extension. Other functions can be provided by implementing a FunctionPath, and adding them to the configuration file]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.description: Gets the count of names for given record

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.summary: Get map of names grouped by name types
get.description: Gets a JSON Object which is a map from name types to lists of names that match those types.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.description: Generates a tree of parent / children substances connected by certain relationship types, settable in the config file. Gets an array of substance relationships that form a flat relationship tree

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id the substance. This is typically the uuid, but a unique name/code or approvalID will also resolve to the record.

500.description: Record ID or path not understood

get.summary: Get search suggestions from partially typed word "ibupro"
get.description: Returns a list of suggestions for completing supplied text, grouped by fields where that text was found. This can be used for rapid suggestions for global searches.
Searches (globally) for any substance with 'ASPIRIN' found as a word somewhere in the record. This also returns metadata for top/skip and count information.

get.summary: Search Substance by approvlID, which in the default FDA-seeded system is equivalent to the UNII code.
get.description: Searches for a substance with approvalID (UNII) as 'R16CO5Y76E'

get.summary: Search for "OXYTOCIN" inside of a name
get.description: Searches for any substance with "OXYTOCIN" found as a word somewhere in a NAME. Returns metadata for top/skip and count information

get.summary: Substance search for "OXYTOCIN" within codes which also have codesystem containing "WIKIPEDIA"
get.description: Searches for any substance where 'OXYTOCIN' is found as a word somewhere in the record, and there is a code with a codeSystem of 'WIKIPEDIA'

Searches for any substance with "OXYTOCIN" is an EXACT name match. The "^" character (encoded as %5E), surrounded by quotes, is used to mean the start of a field. The "$" character (encoded as %24), also surrounded by quotes, is used to mean the end of a field. Returns metadata for top/skip and count information
Searches for any substance with a word starting with 'OXYTO'
Searches for any substance with a word starting with 'APT-101'
Searches for any substance with a word containing '2-Dimethyl'
Searches for any substance with the words "ESTER" or "ASPIRIN" contained (lots of matches).
Searches for any substance with the words "ESTER" AND "ASPIRIN" contained in any field (few matches).

get.summary: Substance search for words that end in "MAB" and are restricted to proteins.
get.description: Using facet filters, this search restricts the results to only include records which have "protein" as their "Substance Class", while also doing a search for words that end in "MAB". Note that facet filters can be applied to any search.

get.summary: Substance search for words that end in "MAB" and are restricted to proteins with ATC level 1 code in "RESPRITORY SYSTEM".
get.description: Using facet filters, this search restricts the results to only include records which have "protein" as their "Substance Class", and "RESPRITORY SYSTEM" as their "ATC Level 1" facet value. In addition, this also is also doing a search for words that end in "MAB". Note that facet filters can be applied to any search.

get.summary: Get queries from the query list id.
get.description: Returns list of queries. If the id does not exist. It returns an empty list.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of the query list

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: top of the query list

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: skip of the query list

delete.summary: Delete queries from the query list id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of the query list

post.description: Returns the "id" of the query list saved. In the request body, one query per line is expected.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: top of the query list

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: skip of the query list

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: query list, one query per line

get.summary: bulk search on saved query list.
get.description: Returns the search result of the bulk search on query list specified by "bulkQID".

parameters.name: bulkQID
parameters.description: the id of the query list

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: top of the result list

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: skip of the result list

parameters.name: qTop
parameters.description: top of the result summary list

parameters.name: qSkip
parameters.description: skip of the result summary list

parameters.name: fdim
parameters.description: facet dimension

parameters.name: searchOnIdentifiers
parameters.description: true (default) for searching with identifiers, or false for searching with more complex queries

401.description: the query list ID does not exist

500.description: Error during bulk search

get.summary: Substructure search for SMILES/SMARTS string "COCN" -  Async
get.description: Searches substances for any structure containing the substructure described by the SMILES string "COCN". This is an asynchronous result. Returns a JSONObject with a link and metadata for the full response, as well as a URL for polling if the response has been completed yet or not.

get.summary: Substructure search for SMILES/SMARTS string "COCN" - Sync
get.description: Searches substances for any structure containing the substructure described by the SMILES string "COCN". This form of the query will block until the search is complete, and then redirect to a resource which contains the results.

get.summary: Searches for similar structures to SMILES "CCOC(N)=O"
get.description: Searches substances similar structures to "CCOC(N)=O", with tanimoto cutoff of 0.6 (60%). This is an asynchronous result. Returns a JSONObject with a link and metadata for the full response, as well as a URL for polling if the response has been completed yet or not.

get.summary: Searches substances for structure equivalent to SMILES string "CCOC(N)=O".
get.description: Searches substances for chemical structures that are tautomerically equivalent to the supplied SMILEs string. This is a stereo sensitive search.

get.summary: Searches substances for disconnected moiety equivalent to SMILES string "Cl".
get.description: Searches substances for disconnected moiety equivalent to SMILES string "Cl". This is a stereo-insensitive search.
List of suggest fields to help with autocomplete
Gets facet value breakdown for facet "Code System" in ASPIRIN search.

get.summary: Search for "ASPIRIN" with "Code System" facet values start with "W"
get.description: Gets facet value breakdown for facet 'Code System' in ASPIRIN search, filtering to only facet values which start with 'W'

get.summary: Search for "ASPIRIN" with "Code System" facet count between 0 and 1
get.description: Gets facet value breakdown for facet "Code System" in ASPIRIN search, filtering to only facet values with count between 0 and 1

post.description: Validate a substance - returns valid=false for any errors

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: json of the substance

get.summary: "approve" a substance to generate approval ID
get.description: Approve/Validate a pending substance to create the approval ID. User can not approve their own substances

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: uuid of the substance

500.description: Server error

get.summary: Get the names of all the user saved lists owned by current user.
get.description: Returns list of the names of user saved lists of the current user.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: top of the list of user saved lists

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: skip of the list of user saved lists

get.summary: ADMIN ROLE ONLY! Get all the names of user saved lists of owned by a specified user.
get.description: Returns list of the names of user saved lists of a specified user. If a user name is not specified, returns names of all user saved lists.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: user name

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: top of the list of user saved lists

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: skip of the list of user saved lists

get.summary: Get the list(specified in the path) content of current user.
get.description: Returns an array of the list content of the user saved list specified in the path with "list". Returns empty list if the list does not exist.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: top of the specified user saved list

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: skip of the specified user saved list

get.summary: ADMIN ROLE ONLY! Get the user saved list(specified in the path) content of the user(specified in the path).
get.description: Returns an array of the list content of the specified user saved list owned by the specified user. Returns empty list if the list does not exist.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: top of the specified user saved list

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: skip of the specified user saved list

post.summary: Create a user saved list with list of UUIDs of the substances in the body, separated by comma. For example, deb33005-e87e-4e7f-9704-d5b4c80d3023,79dbcc59-e887-40d1-a0e3-074379b755e4.
post.description: Returns an id which can be used to check the status of this process with the endpoint @userList/status/{id}.

parameters.name: listName
parameters.description: The name of the user saved list

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: The list of UUIDs to save in the user saved list

400.description: User list with the same name already exists

post.summary: Create a user saved list with etag with the specified etag id. For example, @userList/7c9f73c931335ca3?listName="myList".
post.description: Returns an id which can be used to check the status of this process with the endpoint @userList/status/{id}.

parameters.name: listName
parameters.description: The name of the user saved list

400.description: User list with the same name already exists

put.summary: Add more substances to the user saved list using etag.
put.description: Add the substances specified by etag id to the user saved list owned by current user. Returns an id which can be used to check the status of this process with the endpoint @userList/status/{id}.

parameters.name: listName
parameters.description: name of the user saved list to update

404.description: User list or etag is not found

put.summary: Update the user saved list by adding more substances to the list or remove substances from the list.
put.description: Returns an id which can be used to check the status of this process with the endpoint @userList/status/{id}.

parameters.name: listName
parameters.description: name of the user saved list to update

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: UUIDs that will be updated in the user saved list

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Operation, "ADD" to add to the list, or "REMOVE" to remove from the list

404.description: User or user list is not found

delete.summary: Delete the entire user saved list specified by list name.

parameters.name: listName
parameters.description: name of the user saved list to delete

404.description: The user list is not found

put.summary: ADMIN ROLE ONLY! Update the user saved list by adding more substances to the list or remove substances from the list.
put.description: Returns an id which can be used to check the status of this process with the endpoint @userList/status/{id}.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: Owner of the user saved list to delete

parameters.name: listName
parameters.description: name of the user saved list to update

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: UUIDs that will be updated in the user saved list

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Operation, "ADD" to add to the list, or "REMOVE" to remove from the list

400.description: Illegal userName, listName, keys, or operation

delete.summary: ADMIN ROLE ONLY! Delete the entire user saved list specified by user name and list name.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: Owner of the user saved list to delete

parameters.name: listName
parameters.description: Name of the user saved list to delete

get.summary: Get the status of a saving or updating user saved list process.
get.description: Returns the status of the process.

get.summary: Get the difference between database and indexes
get.description: Returns the ids that exist only in database or in indexes, and the counts.

put.summary: Reindex substances records that are in database, but not in indexes
put.description: Returns the id this async job.

get.description: Returns the reindex job status.

404.description: Could not find the job identified by id

get.summary: Rebackup the record specified by id.
get.description: Returns the record rebacked.

404.description: Could not find the record identified by id

put.summary: Rebackup the records specified by the list of ids.

get.summary: Rebackup and reindex the record specified by id.
get.description: Returns the record rebacked and reindexed.

404.description: Could not find the record identified by id

put.summary: Rebackup the records specified by the list of ids.

get.summary: Fetch a list of scheduled jobs
get.description: Returns a list of ID's, statuses, descriptions, and calls to modify scheduled server tasks

get.summary: Fetch a list of scheduled jobs
get.description: Returns the ID, status, description, and calls to modify a specific scheduled server task

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the 'id' property of a specific job

get.description: Returns information about the Database information, cache configuration, and runtime environment
Returns an array of information about each registered user (except passwords)
Returns information about a specific user (except for their password)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the 'id' or 'username' property of a specific user

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The username or id property of that user, either works

post.description: Adds a user by posting required user information

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The JSON object of the user to be added

put.description: Edits information about a specific a user by putting an edited user object

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The edited JSON of the user

post.description: let's an admin change someone else's password i.e. for a password reset

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the 'id' property of a specific user, as long is it is not yourself

parameters.name: newPassword
parameters.description: The new password

post.description: Allows the currently logged in user to change their own password

parameters.name: oldPassword
parameters.description: The current password

parameters.name: newPassword
parameters.description: The new password

post.description: Load a record data set into the database. The call returns a JSON object containing the job ID property

parameters.name: preserve-audit
parameters.description: whether audit data should be imported. Boolean value as string

parameters.name: file-name
parameters.description: The full file to be imported

parameters.name: file-type
parameters.description: The file extension. currently only supports .gsrs

get.description: returns JSON with information about a loaded data set, such as it's current status and progress

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the id of the load job in the response of the admin/load call

get.description: returns a JSON object containing a list of available export file types and api calls to begin exporting

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: the type of search - substances, structure, or sequence

parameters.name: etag
parameters.description: The etag value of the current /{search type}/search response containing the records to be exported.

get.description: Begin the process of creating an export file. The response contains an ID for the download

parameters.name: etag
parameters.description: The etag value of the current /{search type}/search response containing the records to be exported.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: the type of search, usually substances

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: the desired export file name

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: the file type of the export

parameters.name: exportConfigId
parameters.description: a known export configuration

get.description: Set of nested options for the record scrubber used by GSRS to restrict export data
Set of nested options for the record expander used by GSRS add related records to an export data set

Scrubber and expander settings for a single export configuration. Output includes any standard configurations that are not saved in the database as well as regular configurations that are saved in the database.  Configurations do not include export file information.
Scrubber and expander settings for a single export configuration from the database. Configurations do not include export file information.

put.description: Save a modified export configuration (scrubber, expander and entity type) to the database. Configurations do not include export file information.

400.description: Bad request, for example, if a configuration with the specified ID does not exist

delete.description: Delete an export configuration (scrubber, expander and entity type) from the database.

400.description: Bad request, for example, if a configuration with the specified ID does not exist

post.description: Save a new export configuration (scrubber, expander and entity type) to the database. Configurations do not include export file information.

get.description: Retrieve information about all of a users exports

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the export process. Found in the response of the /export/{etag} call

get.description: Retrieve information about an export status, and a url where the file can be deleted, cancelled, or downloaded if complete

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the export process. Found in the response of the /export/{etag} call
